Package com.intellij.psi

Class SmartPointerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.psi.SmartPointerManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SmartPointerManagerImpl

    public abstract class SmartPointerManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows to create references to PSI elements that can survive a reparse and return the corresponding element in the PSI tree after the reparse.

      • createSmartPsiFileRangePointer

        public abstract SmartPsiFileRange createSmartPsiFileRangePointer(PsiFile file,
                                                                 TextRange range)

      • getInstance

        public static SmartPointerManager getInstance(Project project)

      • createPointer

        public static <E extends PsiElement> SmartPsiElementPointer<E> createPointer(E element)
        Creates a smart pointer to the specified PSI element using a manager that corresponds to the element's project.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the specific type of the given element
        Parameters:
        element - the element to create a pointer to
        Returns:
        a pointer to the specified element which can survive PSI reparse
        See Also:
        createSmartPsiElementPointer(PsiElement)

      • createSmartPsiElementPointer

        public abstract <E extends PsiElement> SmartPsiElementPointer<E> createSmartPsiElementPointer(E element)
        Creates a smart pointer to the specified PSI element. If the element's containing file is known, it's more preferable to use createSmartPsiElementPointer(PsiElement, PsiFile).
        Parameters:
        element - the element to create a pointer to.
        Returns:
        the smart pointer instance.

      • createSmartPsiElementPointer

        public abstract <E extends PsiElement> SmartPsiElementPointer<E> createSmartPsiElementPointer(E element,
                                                                                              PsiFile containingFile)
        Creates a smart pointer to the specified PSI element.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to create a pointer to.
        containingFile - the result of element.getContainingFile().
        Returns:
        the smart pointer instance.

      • createLazyPointer

        @Deprecated
public <E extends PsiElement> SmartPsiElementPointer<E> createLazyPointer(E element)
        Deprecated. use createSmartPsiElementPointer(PsiElement) instead
        Creates a smart pointer to the specified PSI element which doesn't hold a strong reference to the PSI element.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to create a pointer to.
        Returns:
        the smart pointer instance.

      • pointToTheSameElement

        public abstract boolean pointToTheSameElement(SmartPsiElementPointer<?> pointer1,
                                              SmartPsiElementPointer<?> pointer2)
        This method is cheaper than dereferencing both pointers and comparing the result.
        Parameters:
        pointer1 - smart pointer to compare
        pointer2 - smart pointer to compare
        Returns:
        true if both pointers point to the same PSI element.

      • removePointer

        public abstract void removePointer(SmartPsiElementPointer<?> pointer)
        Disposes a smart pointer and frees the resources associated with it. Calling this method is not obligatory: pointers are freed correctly when they're not used anymore. But disposing the pointers explicitly might be beneficial for performance.
